chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald R Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing in Court, Court withdrew previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests adjourned Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Further, defense counsel provides an update to the court and advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Case adjourned for a Pre-Trial Conference/ Calendar Call to Br 41.
Calendar call scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court he still needs additional discovery and global offer from the state.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. 
Amended criminal complaint clarifying date range as to Count 1; copy served on defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended criminal complaint, waives formal reading.
Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjournedfor status conference by Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is not available. Defendant is having technical difficulties with zoom. Parties request an adjournment. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/21/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.A.S. (dob 11/19/1993) and J.W.G. (dob 4/28/1951).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA as to COUNTS 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
